labels.analysis: The MCP Server is designed to fetch job listings from Stepstone.de, a job portal, by allowing users to search based on keywords and location parameters. It outputs structured job results in JSON format for easy integration into automation workflows or autonomous agents. The core functionality revolves around web search for job listings and integration with other systems via stdin/stdout communication.
labels.reasoning: The primary label "Web Search & Research" fits well because the server's main purpose is to search and retrieve job listings from a specific website, which is a form of web research. The secondary label "API Integration" is relevant because the server allows integration into automation workflows using standard input/output communication, suggesting it can be used as part of a larger system. No custom label is needed as the predefined categories adequately describe the functionality.

tools.name: search_jobs

server_info_crawled.name: Stepstone Job Listings Fetcher
server_info_crawled.author: @kdkiss/mcp-stepstone
server_info_crawled.overview: Fetch dynamic job listings from Stepstone.de based on keywords and location parameters. Integrate seamlessly into autonomous agents or automation workflows using stdin/stdout communication. Receive structured job results in JSON format for easy processing.

tools.name: search_jobs
tools.description: Search for job listings on Stepstone.de using multiple search terms

search_terms.description: List of job search terms to look for

zip_code.description: German postal code for location-based search

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@kdkiss/mcp-stepstone/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
